result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony A. Griesbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.  The Defendant is to complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant may not change residence or employment without prior approval of the agent.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is subject to random drug/UA/breath testing.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  Court orders expungement per Wisconsin Statute #973.015, upon successful completion of probation, and has no violations while on probation.

timeConds.notes:
AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY.
Consecutive to any other sentence.  Lock up.  Stayed.
To be completed by 6/11/5.  Total with 14CM738.
